newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan calls for Iraqi withdrawal from Kurd areas.
newsitem.headline: Japan calls for Iraqi withdrawal from Kurd areas.

text.p: Japan, the world's biggest importer of Middle East oil and a strong backer of U.S. action against Iraq, on Wednesday called for Baghdad to immediately withdraw its forces from Kurdish areas of the country.
Speaking minutes after the United States announced its second missile attack on Iraq, deputy government spokesman Kazo Watanabe said the crisis could only be settled by an Iraqi withdrawal.
"Japan strongly hopes for Iraq to withdraw from the northern areas (of Iraq) in order to settle the situation at the earliest possible instant," Kazo told a news conference.
In comments earlier on Wednesday before the second U.S. attack, Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto said he was concerned at the size of forces Iraq was moving into Kurdish areas.

"Although I haven't actually seen everything on a satellite or anything, I am concerned that the Iraqis are moving thousands of military men and hundreds of tanks to the Kurdish area," Hashimoto said.
